metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5211 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
Under some situations, the Spring Framework 4.2.0 to 4.2.1, 4.0.0 to 4.1.7,3.2.0 to 3.2.14 and older unsupported versions is vulnerable to a ReflectedFile Download (RFD) attack. The attack involves a malicious user crafting aURL with a batch script extension that results in the response beingdownloaded rather than rendered and also includes some input reflected inthe response.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5211` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libspring-aop-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-beans-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-context-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-context-support-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-core-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-expression-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-instrument-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-jdbc-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-jms-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-messaging-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-orm-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-oxm-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-test-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-transaction-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-web-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-web-portlet-java - 4.3.14-1
libspring-web-servlet-java - 4.3.14-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libspring-java package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.14-1').
